name: Sunrise Park
history: Built in 1980 as a recreational spot near the Krishna River
appealing_text: A serene escape amidst vibrant gardens and river views

name: The Taj Mahal
history: Built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1632 in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal
appealing_text: A symbol of eternal love, offering breathtaking views and intricate architecture

name: Qutub Minar
history: Built in 1193 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak, the founder of the Delhi Sultanate
appealing_text: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with historical significance and architectural grandeur

name: India Gate
history: Built in 1931 as a war memorial to honor Indian soldiers who died during World War I
appealing_text: A majestic war memorial, a symbol of India's courage

name: Red Fort
history: Built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1638, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
appealing_text: A stunning example of Mughal architecture and history

name: Gateway of India
history: Built in 1924 to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary
appealing_text: A grand entrance by the sea with a rich history
by_road_distances_from_airports: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (25 km)

name: Victoria Memorial
history: Built in 1921 to commemorate Queen Victoria’s reign
appealing_text: A majestic white marble building surrounded by lush gardens
airports: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport
by_road_distances_from_airports: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (20 km)

name: Mysore Palace
history: Built in 1912, the official residence of the Wadiyar family
appealing_text: A stunning palace with grandeur and intricate design

name: Golden Temple
history: Built in 1581, the holiest Gurdwara of Sikhism
appealing_text: A spiritual and serene destination for reflection
airports: Sri Guru Ram Dass Jee International Airport
by_road_distances_from_airports: Sri Guru Ram Dass Jee International Airport (10 km)

name: Chichen Itza
history: Built in the 16th century by Maharaja Man Singh I
appealing_text: A stunning fort showcasing the architectural marvel of Rajasthan

name: The Lotus Temple
history: Built in 1986 as a Baháʼí House of Worship
appealing_text: A symbol of peace and harmony with a unique architectural design

name: Charminar
history: Built in 1591 by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah
appealing_text: An iconic landmark with grand arches and historic significance

name: Elephant Falls
history: A picturesque waterfall nestled in the Khasi Hills
appealing_text: A peaceful retreat offering natural beauty and tranquility

name: Sanchi Stupa
history: Built by Emperor Ashoka in 3rd century BCE, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
appealing_text: A historic and peaceful site for learning about Buddhism

name: Rishikesh
history: Known for its spiritual significance and adventure sports
appealing_text: A serene town nestled along the banks of the Ganges River

name: Andaman Islands
history: A collection of over 500 islands, known for their beaches
appealing_text: An untouched paradise with crystal clear waters and rich marine life

name: Hampi
history: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the former Vijayanagara capital
appealing_text: A city filled with ancient temples and stone monuments

name: Leh-Ladakh
history: A popular destination for trekking, biking, and Buddhist culture
appealing_text: A cold desert full of natural beauty, monasteries, and mountains

name: Ajanta Caves
history: Dating back to 2nd century BC, Ajanta Caves are famous for ancient Buddhist murals and sculptures
appealing_text: A fascinating journey into ancient Buddhist history and art

name: Sikkim
history: Known for its monasteries, trekking routes, and stunning mountain views
appealing_text: A peaceful and scenic state with Buddhist monasteries and mountain trails

name: Coorg
history: Famous for its coffee plantations and scenic hills
appealing_text: A charming hill station with lush coffee estates and waterfalls

name: Kodaikanal
history: A charming hill station known for its cool climate and scenic views
appealing_text: A peaceful retreat surrounded by lush greenery and misty landscapes

name: Rann of Kutch
history: Known for the annual Rann Utsav and salt desert landscapes
appealing_text: A unique landscape where the salt desert meets the sky

name: Sundarbans
history: A UNESCO World Heritage site, famous for the Royal Bengal Tiger
appealing_text: A sprawling mangrove forest and sanctuary for wildlife
